name: Master Warcraft
text:
Cast Master Warcraft only before attackers are declared.
You choose which creatures attack this turn.
You choose which creatures block this turn and how those creatures block.

name: Masterwork of Ingenuity
text: You may have Masterwork of Ingenuity enter the battlefield as a copy of any Equipment on the battlefield.

editions.flavor:
"The crucible yields what you have forged in your mind. You need only reach in and draw the masterwork forth."
—Wahara, Keeper of the Crucible

name: Mastery of the Unseen
text:
Whenever a permanent you control is turned face up, you gain 1 life for each creature you control.
{3}{W}: Manifest the top card of your library. (Put it onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature. Turn it face up any time for its mana cost if it's a creature card.)

name: Masticore
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Masticore unless you discard a card.
{2}: Masticore deals 1 damage to target creature.
{2}: Regenerate Masticore.

name: Masumaro, First to Live
text: Masumaro, First to Live's power and toughness are each equal to twice the number of cards in your hand.

editions.flavor:
"In the waning moments of war, humanity's most ancient ancestors return. But whose side shall they make their own?"
—Isao, Enlightened Bushi

name: Matca Rioters
text: Domain — Matca Rioters's power and toughness are each equal to the number of basic land types among lands you control.

editions.flavor: When outsiders interrupted the matca championship, things got ugly.
When outsiders interrupted the matca championship, things got ugly.

name: Matopi Golem
text: {1}: Regenerate Matopi Golem. When it regenerates this way, put a -1/-1 counter on it.

editions.flavor: Some potmakers claim to use the mud of such creatures to make their finest bowls—and that the bowls scream when fired.

name: Matsu-Tribe Birdstalker
text:
Whenever Matsu-Tribe Birdstalker deals combat damage to a creature, tap that creature and it doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
{G}: Matsu-Tribe Birdstalker gains reach until end of turn. (It can block creatures with flying.)

name: Matsu-Tribe Decoy
text:
{2}{G}: Target creature blocks Matsu-Tribe Decoy this turn if able.
Whenever Matsu-Tribe Decoy deals combat damage to a creature, tap that creature and it doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

name: Matsu-Tribe Sniper
text:
{T}: Matsu-Tribe Sniper deals 1 damage to target creature with flying.
Whenever Matsu-Tribe Sniper deals damage to a creature, tap that creature and it doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

name: Matter Reshaper
text:
({C} represents colorless mana.)
When Matter Reshaper dies, reveal the top card of your library. You may put that card onto the battlefield if it's a permanent card with converted mana cost 3 or less. Otherwise, put that card into your hand.

name: Maulfist Doorbuster
text:
When Maulfist Doorbuster enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
Whenever Maulfist Doorbuster attacks, you may pay {E}. If you do, target creature can't block this turn.

editions.flavor: "Knock, knock . . . too late."

name: Maulfist Revolutionary
text:
Trample
When Maulfist Revolutionary enters the battlefield or dies, for each kind of counter on target permanent or player, give that permanent or player another counter of that kind.

name: Maulfist Squad
text:
Menace
Fabricate 1 (When this creature enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on it or create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token.)

editions.flavor: "Nice invention there. Looks real fragile."

name: Maul Splicer
text:
When Maul Splicer enters the battlefield, create two 3/3 colorless Golem artifact creature tokens.
Golem creatures you control have trample.

name: Mausoleum Guard
text: When Mausoleum Guard dies, create two 1/1 white Spirit creature tokens with flying.

editions.flavor: "Ghoulcallers trying to get in, geists trying to get out . . . . This duty is never dull."
"Ghoulcallers trying to get in, geists trying to get out . . . . This duty is never dull."

name: Mausoleum Turnkey
text: When Mausoleum Turnkey enters the battlefield, return target creature card of an opponent's choice from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor: When he reaches for his key ring, you should be running for the exit.
When he reaches for his key ring, you should be running for the exit.

name: Mausoleum Wanderer
text:
Flying
Whenever another Spirit enters the battlefield under your control, Mausoleum Wanderer gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
Sacrifice Mausoleum Wanderer: Counter target instant or sorcery spell unless its controller pays {X}, where X is Mausoleum Wanderer's power.

name: Maverick Thopterist
text:
Improvise (Your artifacts can help cast this spell. Each artifact you tap after you're done activating mana abilities pays for {1}.)
When Maverick Thopterist enters the battlefield, create two 1/1 colorless Thopter artifact creature tokens with flying.

name: Mawcor
text:
Flying
{T}: Mawcor deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor: From its maw comes neither word nor whisper—only wind.
From its maw comes neither word nor whisper—only wind.
Neither head holds a brain—that's located somewhere in the chest—but four eyes aim much better than two.

name: Maw of Kozilek
text:
Devoid (This card has no color.)
{C}: Maw of Kozilek gets +2/-2 until end of turn. ({C} represents colorless mana.)

editions.flavor:
"The Eldrazi make worse than ruins—they make a world where not even ruins stand."
—Gideon Jura

name: Maw of the Mire
text: Destroy target land. You gain 4 life.

editions.flavor: As the chapel was dragged under, the bell in the tower rang until the murky depths forever silenced its toll.

name: Maw of the Obzedat
text: Sacrifice a creature: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: The devout sacrifice themselves to it hoping for escape from their debts to the guild, but many end up owing in the afterlife.

name: Mayael's Aria
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control if you control a creature with power 5 or greater. Then you gain 10 life if you control a creature with power 10 or greater. Then you win the game if you control a creature with power 20 or greater.

name: Mayael the Anima
text: {3}{R}{G}{W}, {T}: Look at the top five cards of your library. You may put a creature card with power 5 or greater from among them onto the battlefield. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

editions.flavor: The sacred Anima's eyes are blind to all but the grandest truths.
The sacred Anima's eyes are blind to all but the grandest truths.

name: Mayael the Anima Avatar
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a creature card with power 5 or greater, put it into your hand. Otherwise, you may put it on the bottom of your library.

editions.flavor: ALA Participation Avatar

name: May Civilization Collapse
text: When you set this scheme in motion, target opponent chooses self or others. If that player chooses self, he or she sacrifices two lands. If the player chooses others, each of your other opponents sacrifices a land.

editions.flavor: "This should halt the spread of your insolence."

name: Mayor of Avabruck
text:
Other Human creatures you control get +1/+1.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Mayor of Avabruck.

editions.flavor: He can deny his true nature for only so long.
He can deny his true nature for only so long.

name: Maze Abomination
text:
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
Multicolored creatures you control have deathtouch.

name: Maze Behemoth
text:
Trample
Multicolored creatures you control have trample.

editions.flavor: It returned to the leylines as quickly as it had appeared, leaving only broken bodies to mark its passage.

name: Maze Glider
text:
Flying
Multicolored creatures you control have flying.

editions.flavor: The pattern of the Implicit Maze extends in more than two dimensions.

name: Maze of Ith
text: {T}: Untap target attacking creature. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by that creature this turn.

name: Maze of Shadows
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{T}: Untap target attacking creature with shadow. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by that creature this turn.

name: Maze Rusher
text:
Haste
Multicolored creatures you control have haste.

editions.flavor:
"The maze seems to fight us at every turn, resisting our efforts to solve it."
—Niv-Mizzet

name: Maze's End
text:
Maze's End enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{3}, {T}, Return Maze's End to its owner's hand: Search your library for a Gate card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library. If you control ten or more Gates with different names, you win the game.

name: Maze Sentinel
text:
Vigilance
Multicolored creatures you control have vigilance.

editions.flavor: The route has been known for millennia, but only by those with no means to tell it.

name: Mazirek, Kraul Death Priest
text:
Flying
Whenever a player sacrifices another permanent, put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control.

editions.flavor: The clicks and buzz of the undercity proclaim him the incarnation of decay.

name: Meadowboon
text:
When Meadowboon leaves the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on each creature target player controls.
Evoke {3}{W} (You may cast this spell for its evoke cost. If you do, it's sacrificed when it enters the battlefield.)

name: Meandering River
text:
Meandering River enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {W} or {U} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: The river split into many channels as it flowed to the Halimar Sea. Few travelers could follow the same one twice.

name: Meandering Towershell
text:
Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
Whenever Meandering Towershell attacks, exile it. Return it to the battlefield under your control tapped and attacking at the beginning of the declare attackers step on your next turn.

name: Measure of Wickedness
text:
At the beginning of your end step, sacrifice Measure of Wickedness and you lose 8 life.
Whenever another card is put into your graveyard from anywhere, target opponent gains control of Measure of Wickedness.

name: Mechanized Production
text:
Enchant artifact you control
At the beginning of your upkeep, create a token that's a copy of enchanted artifact. Then if you control eight or more artifacts with the same name as one another, you win the game.

editions.flavor:
"Give me eight walkers, I'll give you the city."
—Dovin Baan

name: Meddle
text: If target spell has only one target and that target is a creature, change that spell's target to another creature.

editions.flavor:
"Shadimir was as surprised as he was relieved when the blow turned aside."
—Afari, Tales
Strength may win the fight, but style wins the crowd.

name: Meddling Kids
text:
As Meddling Kids comes into play, choose a word with four or more letters.
Nonland cards with the chosen word in their text box can't be played.

editions.flavor: These kids know their four-letter words.

name: Meddling Mage
text:
As Meddling Mage enters the battlefield, name a nonland card.
The named card can't be cast.

editions.flavor: "This violent wasteland is an indictment of its people. These cowards lack the will to oppose disorder."
Meddling mages chant so loudly that no one can get a spell in edgewise.
Meddling mages chant so loudly that no one can get a spell in edgewise.

name: Medicine Bag
text: {1}, {T}, Discard a card: Regenerate target creature.

editions.flavor:
"My medicine bag and I have treated countless wounds and illnesses. But never have I seen so many made so sick for so long. We will never eat Squee's cooking again."
—Orim, journal

name: Medicine Runner
text: When Medicine Runner enters the battlefield, you may remove a counter from target permanent.

editions.flavor: Elvish healers carry vials of the balm known as dawnglow, reserving it for those wounds that herbs cannot treat.

name: Meditate
text: Draw four cards. You skip your next turn.

editions.flavor:
"Part of me believes that Barrin taught me meditation simply to shut me up."
—Ertai, wizard adept

"Part of me believes that Barrin taught me meditation simply to shut me up."
—Ertai, wizard adept

name: Meditation Puzzle
text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
You gain 8 life.

editions.flavor: Find your center, and you will find your way.

name: Medomai the Ageless
text:
Flying
Whenever Medomai the Ageless deals combat damage to a player, take an extra turn after this one.
Medomai the Ageless can't attack during extra turns.

name: Meekstone
text: Creatures with power 3 or greater don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.

editions.flavor: When the mighty sleep, the lowly prowl.
When the mighty sleep, the lowly prowl.
The bigger they are, the stronger its pull.

"When it oscillated above a particular frequency, the stone induced acute listlessness in several researchers."
—Consulate engineer's log

name: Megantic Sliver
text: Sliver creatures you control get +3/+3.

editions.flavor: Even the thrums, the lowliest of slivers, become deadly in its presence.
Even the thrums, the lowliest of slivers, become deadly in its presence.

name: Megatherium
text:
Trample
When Megatherium enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you pay {1} for each card in your hand.

name: Megatog
text: Sacrifice an artifact: Megatog gets +3/+3 and gains trample until end of turn.

editions.flavor: In an ironic bit of evolution, the megatog's dozens of teeth are mainly ornamental. It prefers swallowing things whole.

name: Meglonoth
text:
Vigilance, trample
Whenever Meglonoth blocks a creature, Meglonoth deals damage to that creature's controller equal to Meglonoth's power.

editions.flavor: When the shards merged, Mayael found herself the general of Naya's mightiest army.

name: Megrim
text: Whenever an opponent discards a card, Megrim deals 2 damage to that player.

editions.flavor:
"You can run from your pain, but you will tire before it does."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

"It's a vicious circle. Stress breeds pain. Pain breeds stress. It's simply beautiful, wouldn't you agree?"
—Vradeen, vampire nocturnus
"You can run from your pain," explained Gerrard to Crovax, "but take it from experience: you will tire before it does."
Memories cut from the mind can cut right back.

"It's a vicious circle. Stress breeds pain. Pain breeds stress. It's simply beautiful, wouldn't you agree?"
—Vradeen, vampire nocturnus
Memories cut from the mind can cut right back.

"Pain is both a tool and a craft. Like any tool, it must be sharpened. Like any craft, it must be practiced."
—Hooks, Cabal torturer

name: Meishin, the Mind Cage
text: All creatures get -X/-0, where X is the number of cards in your hand.

editions.flavor: It's dangerous indeed to be lost in someone else's thoughts.

name: Melancholy
text:
Enchant creature
When Melancholy enters the battlefield, tap enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Melancholy unless you pay {B}.

name: Melee
text:
Cast Melee only during your turn and only during combat before blockers are declared.
You choose which creatures block this combat and how those creatures block.
Whenever a creature attacks and isn't blocked this combat, untap it and remove it from combat.

name: Melek, Izzet Paragon
text:
Play with the top card of your library revealed.
You may cast the top card of your library if it's an instant or sorcery card.
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell from your library, copy it. You may choose new targets for the copy.

name: Melesse Spirit
text: Flying, protection from black

editions.flavor: Like a laughing knife, immaculate and sharp, is the Melesse.

name: Meletis Astronomer
text: Heroic — Whenever you cast a spell that targets Meletis Astronomer, look at the top three cards of your library. You may reveal an enchantment card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

name: Meletis Charlatan
text: {2}{U}, {T}: The controller of target instant or sorcery spell copies it. That player may choose new targets for the copy.

editions.flavor: "Every object has an echo in the Æther beyond the world. Every idea has a shadow that can be brought to light."

name: Melira's Keepers
text: Melira's Keepers can't have counters placed on it.

editions.flavor: Her warriors are the last defense against the coming storm.

name: Melira, Sylvok Outcast
text:
You can't get poison counters.
Creatures you control can't have -1/-1 counters placed on them.
Creatures your opponents control lose infect.

editions.flavor: Once a pariah, now Mirrodin's greatest hope.

name: Meloku the Clouded Mirror
text:
Flying
{1}, Return a land you control to its owner's hand: Create a 1/1 blue Illusion creature token with flying.

editions.flavor: He loved his cities in the clouds. When he traveled to the lands below, he brought many reminders of his home.
He loved his cities in the clouds. When he traveled to the lands below, he brought many reminders of his home.

name: Meltdown
text: Destroy each artifact with converted mana cost X or less.

editions.flavor: Catastrophes happened so often at the mana rig that the viashino language had a special word to describe them.

name: Melting
text: All lands are no longer snow.

editions.flavor:
"Who needs the sun when you've got me around?"
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

name: Melt Terrain
text: Destroy target land. Melt Terrain deals 2 damage to that land's controller.

editions.flavor: Just as the most finely wrought metal can warp and rust, so too does Mirrodin buckle under pressures from without and within.

name: Memnarch
text:
{1}{U}{U}: Target permanent becomes an artifact in addition to its other types. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
{3}{U}: Gain control of target artifact. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

editions.flavor: "An imperfection in the perfect world? We can't allow that."
In the blur between metal and flesh, Memnarch found madness.
In the blur between metal and flesh, Memnarch found madness.
Reminders of Memnarch's reign still skirr across Mirrodin, reminiscent of his form if not his power.
Reminders of Memnarch's reign still skirr across Mirrodin, reminiscent of his form if not his power.

name: Memoricide
text: Name a nonland card. Search target player's graveyard, hand, and library for any number of cards with that name and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

editions.flavor: "You claim wisdom, yet I see nothing in here but tawdry wishes."
"You claim wisdom, yet I see nothing in here but tawdry wishes."

name: Memory Crystal
text: Buyback costs cost {2} less.

editions.flavor: Hues of recollection flicker like facets of a gem.

name: Memory Erosion
text: Whenever an opponent casts a spell, that player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

editions.flavor:
"The Filigree Texts do not compel you to act in accordance with their precepts. They only specify the consequences should you fail."
—Lodus of the Ethersworn

"The Filigree Texts do not compel you to act in accordance with their precepts. They only specify the consequences should you fail."
—Lodus of the Ethersworn

name: Memory Jar
text: {T}, Sacrifice Memory Jar: Each player exiles all cards from his or her hand face down and draws seven cards. At the beginning of the next end step, each player discards his or her hand and returns to his or her hand each card he or she exiled this way.

name: Memory Lapse
text: Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, put it on top of its owner's library instead of into that player's graveyard.

editions.flavor:
"Um . . . oh . . . what was I saying?"
—Reveka, Wizard Savant

"Oh, I had a conscience once. But alas, I seem to have forgotten where I put it."
—Chandler

"Um . . . oh . . . what was I saying?"
—Reveka, wizard savant

"To sculpt a mind is to see every memory and thought as an individual piece that can be rearranged—or removed."
—Jace Beleren

"Oh, I had a conscience once. But alas, I seem to have forgotten where I put it."
—Chandler
"Eri phar phesta . . . um, phistor . . . er, phistara . . ."
What a lonely agony, the memory of memories lost.

"The caliph was so intelligent he could not remember what he knew."
—Azeworai, "Three Riddles"

"Um...oh...what was I saying?"
—Reveka, wizard savant

name: Memory Plunder
text: You may cast target instant or sorcery card from an opponent's graveyard without paying its mana cost.

editions.flavor:
"Vengeance is the echo of the victim's own crime."
—Grensch, merrow cutthroat

name: Memory's Journey
text:
Target player shuffles up to three target cards from his or her graveyard into his or her library.
Flashback {G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

name: Memory Sluice
text:
Target player puts the top four cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
Conspire (As you cast this spell, you may tap two untapped creatures you control that share a color with it. When you do, copy it and you may choose a new target for the copy.)

name: Menacing Ogre
text:
Trample, haste
When Menacing Ogre enters the battlefield, each player secretly chooses a number. Then those numbers are revealed. Each player with the highest number loses that much life. If you are one of those players, put two +1/+1 counters on Menacing Ogre.

name: Menagerie Liberator
text:
Trample
Melee (Whenever this creature attacks, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each opponent you attacked with a creature this combat.)

editions.flavor: "The wild are neither your thralls nor your amusement."

name: Mending Hands
text: Prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

editions.flavor:
"I can staunch their blood, mend their flesh, and knit their bones. But I cannot restore their hope."
—Tender-Hand, kitsune healer

"I can staunch their blood, mend their flesh, and knit their bones. But I cannot restore their hope."
—Tender-Hand, kitsune healer

name: Mending Touch
text: Regenerate target creature.

editions.flavor:
"The gift of life must be freely given. Anything less would diminish us all."
—Arin, Selesnya healer

name: Meng Huo, Barbarian King
text: Other green creatures you control get +1/+1.

editions.flavor: The stubborn Meng Huo was captured and released by Kongming seven times before finally surrendering.
The stubborn Meng Huo was captured and released by Kongming seven times before finally surrendering.
Through his allies, Meng Huo commanded several hundred thousand troops composed of cavalry, rattan-armored warriors, infantry, naked men with swords, and wild animals.
Through his allies, Meng Huo commanded several hundred thousand troops composed of cavalry, rattan-armored warriors, infantry, naked men with swords, and wild animals.

name: Mental Agony
text: Target player discards two cards and loses 2 life.

editions.flavor: "His mind is feeble. Feed him to the bats."

name: Mental Discipline
text: {1}{U}, Discard a card: Draw a card.

editions.flavor: Barrin drowned his doubts about Urza's project by delving ever deeper into its details.

name: Mental Misstep
text:
({U/P} can be paid with either {U} or 2 life.)
Counter target spell with converted mana cost 1.

editions.flavor:
"Your first mistake was thinking I would let you live long enough to make a second."
—Sarnvax, Gitaxian sective

name: Mental Note
text:
Put the top two cards of your library into your graveyard.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor: Some minds are more open than others.

name: Mental Vapors
text:
Target player discards a card.
Cipher (Then you may exile this spell card encoded on a creature you control. Whenever that creature deals combat damage to a player, its controller may cast a copy of the encoded card without paying its mana cost.)

name: Mentor of the Meek
text: Whenever another creature with power 2 or less enters the battlefield under your control, you may pay {1}. If you do, draw a card.

editions.flavor: "In these halls there is no pass or fail. Your true test comes with the first full moon."
"In these halls there is no pass or fail. Your true test comes with the first full moon."
"In these halls there is no pass or fail. Your true test comes with the first full moon."

name: Mephidross Vampire
text:
Flying
Each creature you control is a Vampire in addition to its other creature types and has "Whenever this creature deals damage to a creature, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature."

name: Mephitic Ooze
text:
Mephitic Ooze gets +1/+0 for each artifact you control.
Whenever Mephitic Ooze deals combat damage to a creature, destroy that creature. The creature can't be regenerated.

editions.flavor: In Mephidross, refuse doesn't last long—it's all scavenged, reanimated, or consumed.

name: Mercadian Atlas
text: At the beginning of your end step, if you didn't play a land this turn, you may draw a card.

editions.flavor: One may as well chart the clouds as try to map Mercadia.

name: Mercadian Bazaar
text:
Mercadian Bazaar enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Put a storage counter on Mercadian Bazaar.
{T}, Remove any number of storage counters from Mercadian Bazaar: Add {R} to your mana pool for each storage counter removed this way.

name: Mercadian Lift
text:
{1}, {T}: Put a winch counter on Mercadian Lift.
{T}, Remove X winch counters from Mercadian Lift: You may put a creature card with converted mana cost X from your hand onto the battlefield.

name: Mercadia's Downfall
text: Each attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn for each nonbasic land defending player controls.

editions.flavor: With an explosion that shook the foundation of the city, the Weatherlight burst from the underground hangar.

name: Mercenaries
text: {3}: The next time Mercenaries would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage. Any player may activate this ability.

editions.flavor:
"Blasted amateurs! Doesn't the queen think we can fight well enough on our own?"
—Avram Garrisson, Leader of the Knights of Stromgald

name: Mercenary Informer
text:
Mercenary Informer can't be the target of black spells or abilities from black sources.
{2}{W}: Put target nontoken Mercenary on the bottom of its owner's library.

editions.flavor: The problem with rebels is that they so quickly reject authority.

name: Mercenary Knight
text: When Mercenary Knight enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you discard a creature card.
